titleStmt.title: You whirling stream's wild currents
a machine readable transcription

note.p: Draft lines for "Fancies at Navesink," first published in The Nineteenth Century (August 1885).

bibl.author: Whitman, Walt
bibl.title: Fancies at Navesink
bibl.orgName: The Thomas B. Harned Collection of the Papers of Walt Whitman, 1842â€“1937, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.
bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.
In Whitman's hand, lines for a poem, beginning with "A grander, freer race," are drafted on the verso and then crossed out.

lg.head: You ebbingwhirling stream's wild currentsmon
lg.l: W You ebbing—whirling stream's wild currents

To the waning daylight of life and the tide
outrunning fast,

What ardent dreams ye quench
O currents

The silent compblasted ideals ventures
questions, aspirations,‸blasted ideals, burnt⹀out loves,

(On—on to oblivion! On, on,
swifter deeperyet ye blessed waters ‸resperperatingrespirating!
blessed, swelling, ‸floating, plunging, shrouding, corsingcoursing waters!)
